column4: ok, trying to install wvdial-1.61.tar.gz with tar -xvzf wvdial-1.61.tar.gz and I'm getting this error "cannot open: no such file or directory" I have the file on the desktop, so I'm not sure what is going wrong (sorry, very new at this)
try just: tar xf wv*gz
same error
type "cd; cd Desktop" first
to make sure you're "in" the right place
thank you, that worked perfectly (I really didn't know how to navigate via terminal, thank you)
cd is "change directory".  just "cd" on its own takes you "home"
I wasn't sure if the same held true for ubuntu as windws, and cd.. didn't work :)
cd .. needs a space in ubuntu
ahh, that explains it
does the tar -xvzf just extract it, or does it install?
what you have there is a source code archive I expect.  you'll need to extract (you did it), compile, and install it.  you probably can find a package though where that's all done for you
wvdial is in the ubuntu repositories, ready to install from the software centre:
thank you, but I'm still getting errors when I try to compile it
don't try to compile it - just install it from the software centre
see at the bottom of the 'applications' menu?
I'm not connected to the internet on ubuntu. I need wvdial working so I can attempt to get it to connect to dialup
I'm currently on my desktop, and ubuntu is on my laptop
ubuntu 10.04?
yes
ok, so I cannot get wvdial to work, even with a deb.... I'm going to try gnome-ppp next, and hope that works
busy?
